anxiety.title: Panic Attacks and Suicide
anxiety.summary: According to the CDC's latest published report, there were 38,364 suicides in the US in 2010-an average of 105 each day. Globally, an estimated 1 million suicides occur annually.

anxiety.title: Grand Rounds: Neural Mechanisms of Mindfulness Training
anxiety.summary: Mindfulness training is a viable treatment tool that rivals psychopharmaceutical agents for the treatment of addiction, anxiety, depression, and other psychiatric disorders.

anxiety.title: Context Does Not Determine “Disorderness” or Normality
anxiety.summary: The issue of context and its relationship to disorderness extends well beyond panic attacks: it arises in nearly all psychiatric diagnoses not explicitly defined contextually.

anxiety.title: Why Panic Attacks Are Nearly Always Pathological
anxiety.summary: Panic attacks are nearly always pathological and disordered states, even when they occur in an understandable context.

anxiety.title: Migraine and Psychiatric Comorbidity
anxiety.summary: Migraine, particularly chronic migraine, as well as other chronic headaches, have high rates of comorbidity with mood and anxiety disorders.

anxiety.title: Tips for Treating Comorbid Depression and Anxiety
anxiety.summary: Comorbid depressive and anxiety disorders are commonly seen in both primary care and the specialty setting. Such comorbidity can present as major depression with subsyndromal anxiety symptoms or unipolar/bipolar depression with an anxiety disorder.

anxiety.title: The Military Can Do More To Prevent Suicides
anxiety.summary: James Dao reports in the New York Times that the military is considering 2 steps to reduce its startling rate of active duty suicides-which is approaching an unacceptable one suicide every day. Both measures are completely sensible, but neither goes nearly far enough.

anxiety.title: The Epidemic of Military Suicide
anxiety.summary: With understandable urgency, Secretary of Defense Leon Panetta has made suicide one of his top priorities, instructing commanders at all levels to feel acutely accountable for it. The numbers are startling. On average 1 active duty soldier is killing himself each day--twice the number of combat deaths and twice the civilian rate.

anxiety.title: Severe Panic Disorder in a Middle-Aged Man
anxiety.summary: After scoring high on the Panic Disorder Severity Scale, this patient sought panic-focused psychodynamic therapy.

anxiety.title: Monkey Mind: A Memoir of Anxiety
anxiety.summary: Importantly for lay and clinician readers alike, the book Monkey Mind: A Memoir of Anxiety reads as humor-laced triumph with many lost battles along the way rather than enduring unrelenting tragedy.

anxiety.title: Substance Abuse Screening in Patients With Anxiety Disorders
anxiety.summary: How can clinicians reliably identify comorbid drug and alcohol use disorders in patients with anxiety disorders?

anxiety.title: Anxiety Disorders and ADHD: Comorbidity the Rule, Not the Exception
anxiety.summary: ADHD has been significantly associated with a primary diagnosis of impulse control disorder and bipolar disorder and most commonly associated with social phobia and major depressive disorder. Details here. . .

anxiety.title: Psychodynamic-Oriented Group Therapy: A Pathway to Connection
anxiety.summary: For this psychiatrist, group therapy has proved to be an extraordinarily effective treatment for a range of mental disorders.

anxiety.title: Treatment of Insomnia in Anxiety Disorders
anxiety.summary: How often do insomnia and anxiety disorders coexist? And how best to treat patients with comorbid insomnia and anxiety? Answers here..

anxiety.title: Video: Perinatal Anxiety Disorders: Risks, and Treatment Options
anxiety.summary: Perinatal anxiety disorders are common and pose risks to women and their offspring. Here, Laura Miller, MD, speaks briefly on panic disorder, PTSD, and OCD during pregnancy and post-partum, and she offers strategies for crafting effective treatment plans.

anxiety.title: Military Mental Health: An Army of Children
anxiety.summary: This psychiatrist was not prepared for the scope of impact our two long wars have had on military children.

anxiety.title: Crime in the Military-Madness, Badness, and Survival
anxiety.summary: Depression, PTSD, panic disorder, and abuse of alcohol and drugs are more insidious, quieter forms of illness that can cause the same desperation and disability as psychotic disorders.

anxiety.title: Issues in Treating Anxiety Disorders in Pregnancy
anxiety.summary: Anxiety disorders are a frequent occurrence in pregnancy. While some worries and anxiety are experienced by more than 50% of pregnant women, a full-blown anxiety disorder involves risk to both mother and fetus and increases the risk of postpartum depression.

anxiety.title: Anxiety Disorders With Comorbid Substance Abuse
anxiety.summary: Anxiety disorders occur in 18% to 28% of the US general population during any 12-month period. In anxiety disorder, there is a 33% to 45% 12-month prevalence rate for a comorbid substance use disorder (SUD).

anxiety.title: Substance Use Disorders in Patients With Anxiety Disorders
anxiety.summary: In this article, we attempt to leverage state-of-the-art research findings to provide empirically informed perspectives and practices related to these issues.

anxiety.title: Exposure Therapy for Anxiety Disorders
anxiety.summary: Exposure-based therapies are highly effective for patients with anxiety disorders, to the extent that exposure should be considered a first-line, evidence-based treatment for such patients. In clinical practice, however, these treatments are underutilized, which highlights the need for additional dissemination and training.

anxiety.title: The Anxious Bipolar Patient
anxiety.summary: Treatment of anxiety can be a challenge, since the mainstay of treatment may adversely affect the course of bipolar disorder.
